newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks barely move.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks barely move.

text.p: Stocks were barely moving in after-hours trading following a rise in the Dow in reaction to a proposed capital gains tax cut, dealers said Thursday.
"I don't see anything trading out of line with their closing price," said one trader.
Computer chip makes Intel Corp was one of the few stocks trading during the session, remaining at its closing price of 158-3/4 on the Nasdaq Stock Market. It was up 2-7/8 during regular trading.
During normal hours, the Dow Jones Industrial Average ended about 51 points higher at 7137.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 16,400 shares against 24,300 on Wednesday. Session two had 20.1 million against 2.99 million, it said.
